abstract.text: Add and configure supporting views, like toolbars and context menus.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: Use these modifiers to manage supplemental views that present context-specific
controls and information. For example, you can add titles and buttons
to navigation bars, manage the status bar, create context menus, and add
badges many different kinds of views.

SwiftUI-PageImage-card.png.alt: A black Swift logo on a swirly blue and purple background.

View-Fundamentals-PageImage-card.png.alt: A conceptual illustration showing a view decomposed into different components.

abstract.text: Declare the user interface and behavior for your app on every platform.
Use a navigation title to display the current navigation state of an
interface.
Provide space-efficient, context-dependent access to commands and controls.
A view that displays a root view and enables you to present additional
views over the root view.
Provide immediate access to frequently used commands and controls.
A type that represents part of your app’s user interface and provides
modifiers that you use to configure views.
Make your SwiftUI apps accessible to everyone, including people with
disabilities.
Configure a view’s foreground and background styles, controls, and visibility.
Configure charts that you declare with Swift Charts.
Manage the rendering, selection, and entry of text in your view.
Define the visual elements of your app using a hierarchy of views.
Generates a badge for the view from an integer value.
Specifies the prominence of badges created by this view.
Adds an item-based context menu to a view.
Adds a context menu to a view.
Adds a context menu with a custom preview to a view.
Specifies the default placement for the tabs in a tab view using the
adaptable sidebar style.
Adds help text to a view using a text view that you provide.
Hides the navigation bar back button for the view.
Configures the title display mode for this view.
Associates a destination view with a presented data type for use within
a navigation stack.
Associates a destination view with a binding that can be used to push
the view onto a
Associates a destination view with a bound value for use within a
navigation stack or navigation split view
Configures the view’s document for purposes of navigation.
Configures the view’s document for purposes of navigation.
Sets a fixed, preferred width for the column containing this view.
Sets a flexible, preferred width for the column containing this view.
Configures the view’s subtitle for purposes of navigation.
Configures the view’s title for purposes of navigation, using a string
binding.
Presents an ornament.
Adds custom actions to a section.
Sets the visibility of the status bar.
Specifies the customizations to apply to the sidebar representation
of the tab view.
Adds a custom bottom bar to the sidebar of a tab view.
Adds a custom footer to the sidebar of a tab view.
Adds a custom header to the sidebar of a tab view.
Specifies the visibility of a bar managed by SwiftUI.
Populates the toolbar or navigation bar with the specified items.
Populates the toolbar or navigation bar with the specified items,
allowing for user customization.
Remove a toolbar item present by default
Specifies the preferred shape style of the background of a bar managed
by SwiftUI.
Specifies the preferred visibility of backgrounds on a bar managed by
SwiftUI.
Specifies the preferred color scheme of a bar managed by SwiftUI.
Specifies the preferred foreground style of bars managed by SwiftUI.
Configures the semantic role for the content populating the toolbar.
Configures the toolbar title display mode for this view.
Configure the title menu of a toolbar.
Specifies the visibility of a bar managed by SwiftUI.
Sets the Touch Bar content to be shown in the Touch Bar when applicable.
Sets the content that the Touch Bar displays.
Sets a user-visible string that identifies the view’s functionality.
Sets the behavior of the user-customized view.
Sets principal views that have special significance to this Touch Bar.
